page.title: 05Wild Flowers- Treviscoe Area
page.content: There is a great profusion of wild flowers in the area. The most striking displays start around May with{ {rhododendron,}varying shades of{yellow {lupins}followed by{foxgloves}and{ {heather.}Many other wild flowers are easily detected.The include{scabious, {navel wort, spear thistle, rib wort, {rag wort, birdsfoot trefoil}and{meadow {buttercup.} Large numbers of{butterflies}can be discovered by excursions into the "undergrowth"- although brambles are likely to cause the explorer some difficulty!
